revised_title: Biography of Charles Maurice Yonge: A Pioneering Marine Zoologist
tldr: The article is a biography of Charles Maurice Yonge, a distinguished marine zoologist known for his work on marine invertebrate feeding and digestion. He led the Great Barrier Reef Expedition of 1928-1929 and made significant contributions to the study of bivalve mollusks and their evolution. Yonge was a dedicated scientist, teacher, and writer, serving on various professional and government committees throughout his career.
